intro: Lavoisiera cataphracta var. calycina, commonly known as the calycine lavoisiera, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its ornamental value is due to its vibrant flower colors and unique foliage structure, making it a popular choice for garden cultivation.
